Issues.Title: Angular 8 routing with serve-path and deploy-url is broken on refresh
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package angular/*@8.0.6 ### Is this a regression? This used to work in: angular/*@7.2.4 ### Description When using the "serve-path" and "deploy-url" with ng serve, the live reload is broken for routing upon a reload. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Repository here: https://github.com/eplatzek/ng8reloadbug/ Steps to reproduce (using new projects): Using angular/cli @ 8.0.6 ng new ng8 ng g c my-component   update app.component.ts to: ``` constructor(private router: Router) { this.router.navigate(['my-route']); } ```   update app-routing.module.ts to:  ```  const routes: Routes = [ { path: 'my-route', component: MyComponentComponent } ]; @NgModule({ imports: [RouterModule.forRoot(routes, { useHash: true })], exports: [RouterModule] }) ``` update package.json:  ```‚Äùstart": "ng serve --aot --serve-path /my-app/ --deploy-url /my-app/‚Äú,``` Run Yarn start. Navigate to:  http://localhost:4200/my-app. The user is redirected to: http://localhost:4200/#/my-route by the app component.   On page reload at http://localhost:4200/#/my-route, the page displays ‚ÄúCannot GET /‚Äú.  The network tab of the dev tools shows a 404 for http://localhost:4200/. Doing the same exact steps for angular/cli @ 7.2.4 will produce a working page refresh. ## üî• Exception or Error 

‚ÄúCannot GET /‚Äú
## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:**

Node: 10.12.0
OS: darwin x64

Issues.Title: I discover a bug in transfer data between two components that are not in the same level with rxjs/Subject
Issues.Body:
Hi Angular's Team Developer
I what to notice a important issue that I discorded it from angular 5. When we try to transfer(send and receive) data between to components that are not there in the same level. The Subject method is not responsible. 
For example when component A is in a module and component B is in the main root of App folder the Subject method doe not useful and can not transfer data between component A and B. 
At first you should use of subject in a service same at App folder level for sending data from component A to service and after it you should subscribe data in app.component.ts from service and use of @Input() method to send data from app.component.ts to component B.

I found it and test it.
I think angular's team did not have attention to same level of components for transferring data between two components in Subject rxjs method.

+---‚Äî app
|   +--‚Äî Module
|   |   |--component A
|   |   |-->level component A
|   |
|   |  component B 
|   |
|   |--app.component.ts
|   |--app.module.ts 
|   |-->level component B

Sincerely yours
Hassan Khaleghi Rad.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "I discover a bug in transfer data between two components that are not in the same level with rxjs/Subject  " (#31343)

Issues.Title: Dependency injection and class inheritance doesn't work in Angular 8 library test
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package

The issue is caused by package @angular/core@^8

### Is this a regression?
Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: @angular/core@7


### Description

The problem occurs when:

1. The base class has a constructor with an injected service. (`Injector` from the example)

```ts
@Injectable()
export class BaseService {
  // "Injector" is just for the sake of example. Any injectable would have the same problem.
  constructor(public injector: Injector) {
  }
}
```
2. Child class has no constructor (i.e., it relies on base class constructor) AND at least one property with the default value.

```ts
@Injectable()
export class MyLibService extends BaseService {

  public foo = 'bar';

}
```

3. (_dont ask me how I have found this, but:_) In `angular.json` `[lib name].test.options.codeCoverage` should be true. 

### PROBLEM:   

`injector` is undefined in the instance of `MyLibService`. 

--- 

üö© Removing property from the child class _(2)_ AND/OR opting out `codeCoverage` config in angular.json _(3)_ doesn't brake test.

As a result, I can't have a class inheritance and code coverage at the same time.

---

I could put a constructor in the child class and call `super` by passing all required arguments manually, but it's the last option since the real-life scenario is much more complicated than the example provided here.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
git repo: https://github.com/ddramone/ng-8-library-inheritance-di-test-bug

reproduce steps:

1. Install angular 8 cli
2. Clone `git clone https://github.com/ddramone/ng-8-library-inheritance-di-test-bug.git `
3. `npm i`
4. run Test `ng test my-lib`

 ### Expected behavior

Test should pass = Injector service should be available in the service instance.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Dependency injection and class inheritance doesn't work in Angular 8 library test" (#31337)

Issues.Title: feat(ivy): ngcc - handle top-level helper calls in CommonJS
Issues.Body:
Some formats of CommonJS put the decorator helper calls
outside the class IIFE as statements on the top level of the
source file.

This commit add support to the `CommonJSReflectionHost`
for this format.

Issues.Title: Need a way to add response headers to service worker responses
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ 

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for @angular/pwa


### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Need a way to add response headers to responses cached and returned by service worker responses. While using service workers with a CSP, we can run into issues like the one described [here](https://qubyte.codes/blog/content-security-policy-and-service-workers) whose solution is to add a different CSP header for responses returned by service workers as described [here](https://twitter.com/jaffathecake/status/988402162312114177).

I am facing a similar issue as described in the first link above and if can add a header like 'Content-Security-Policy: connect-src *;' to the cached responses returned by the service worker it should solve the problem.

### Describe the solution you'd like
A way to add response headers for responses returned by a service worker

### Describe alternatives you've considered

1. Tried using angular HttpInterceptors to see if I could intercept the service worker response and add the appropriate header.
2. Using plain JS instead of the angular package to have more control over the service worker responses.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Need a way to add response headers to service worker responses" (#31330)

Issues.Title: fix(core): handle `undefined` meta in `injectArgs`
Issues.Body:
In the recent versions of the CLI we introduced a ctor downlevel for VE JIT build based on the one found in tsickle, to fix the TDZ issue of `forwardRef`.

However this caused a regression as the injector is not handling that a position paramType can be undefined. Which is bubbled down to https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/c6b29f4c6d23b1510db3434cb030203d5bdea119/packages/core/src/di/injector_compatibility.ts#L162 and will crash https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/c6b29f4c6d23b1510db3434cb030203d5bdea119/packages/core/src/di/injector_compatibility.ts#L174-L186

Fixes https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/14888

Issues.Title: package.json in guide/elements download
Issues.Body:
# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report

### Description
In the guide about angular/elements there is an example, the issue is related to the code available for download in the end of the session https://angular.io/guide/elements#example-a-popup-service.

While the code itself works, the package.json needs to be updated.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
1) Download the code from the the link int the page, pointing to https://angular.io/generated/zips/elements/elements.zip.
2) Extract the zip in a new folder.
2) npm install
3) ng serve

The package @angular/elements is missing.
the package 
`    "angular-in-memory-web-api": "github:brandonroberts/in-memory-web-api-bazel#50a34d8"
`
require versions < 8.0.0 of some angular packages, it seems that in the mean time the package was added to npm, and now it can be changed to
`    "angular-in-memory-web-api": "0.8.0"`

### What's the affected URL?**
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit:--> https://angular.io/guide/elements

I have noticed a comment in the github source about needing polyfills but in the page it was not clear if any additional step would be required after downloading. Since it is a guide it is supposed to be followed by beginners, and I believed it was something that worth to report.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "package.json in guide/elements download" (#31332)

Issues.Title: feat(bazel): @angular/bazel compat with bazel 0.27 and rules_nodejs 0.32.2
Issues.Body:
Replaces #31019 which was merged but created a g3 issue so was rolled back. This PR includes a minor change to line https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/bazel/src/ng_module.bzl#L272 which should resolve the g3 issue:

```
ERROR: /third_party/javascript/angular2/BUILD:150:1: output 'third_party/javascript/angular2/core_ngc_messages.xmb' was not created
ERROR: /third_party/javascript/angular2/BUILD:150:1: not all outputs were created or valid
Target //javascript/angular2/tools/ngc/e2e:message_extraction_test failed to build
```

* Updates to Bazel 0.27.0 and makes compatibility fixes.
* Updates to rules_nodejs 0.32.2 and makes compatibility fixes for breaking changes since 0.31.x
* Turns on symlinked node_modules finally as 0.32.2 fixes rules_nodejs#802
* Fixes worker mode issue with ts_library (yeay) -- ts_library workers should be turned back on
* Improves how ts_library consumes @types npm packages
***See 0.32.2 release notes for more info: https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/releases/tag/0.32.2***

## rules_nodejs 0.32.0 compat fixes

@npm//node_modules/foobar:foobar.js labels changed to @npm//:node_modules/foobar/foobar.js with fix for bazelbuild/rules_nodejs#802

## Bazel 0.27.0 compat fixes

ctx.new_file is deprecated and ctx.actions.declare_file should be used in Bazel 0.27.0. Error seen here is:
```
        File "ng_module.bzl", line 272, in _expected_outs
                ctx.new_file(ctx.genfiles_dir, (ctx.label.name ..."))
Use ctx.actions.declare_file instead of ctx.new_file.
Use --incompatible_new_actions_api=false to temporarily disable this check.
```
This can be worked around with incompatible_new_actions_api flag but may as well fix it proper so downstream doesn't require this flag due to this code.

Also, depset() is no longer iterable by default without a flag. This required fixing in a few spots in @angular/bazel.

Issues.Title: refactor(ivy): make style application happen automatically
Issues.Body:
This patch removes the need to issue a call to `stylingApply()`
at the end of change detection within a template or host bindings
function. What will happen instead is when the element is exited
(i.e. when `select(n)` is called, when a template exits or when
all host bindings for an element are processed) then styling will
be flushed automatically.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(ivy): make style application happen automatically" (#31321)

Issues.Title: Fix prettier setup for repo
Issues.Body:
Currently there are unsolved problems with prettier. The big ones being

- PRs don't pass prettier check in CI if the PR is not exactly one commit on top of master(This can be fixed)
- Code reviews are messed up because unrelated lines are formatted and pollute the PR and impossible for reviewer to focus on the actual change
- Messes up history/blame pretty quickly if PR changes unrelated lines

Till we figure out an precise prettier format that formats only changed lines we should disable it.

Joey is going to be looking at common formatting solution across various Angular projects.

Previously secondary entry-points, e.g
`@angular/common/http`,  were being resolved to
the primary entry-point, e.g `@angular/common`.
This meant that these entry-points were not being
processed as part of a compilation leading to error messages.

This change inverts the `tryResolvePackage` logic
to attempt to use `require.resolve()` first and only
looking in the parent directory of the typings file
as a fallback if the main resolve fails.

Fixes https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/30972#issuecomment-506428267
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@ngtools/webpack): NGCC should process secondary entry-points" (#14934)

Issues.Title: NodeModuleEngineHost tightly coupled to process working directory
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request

### Description
This is a request for a minor change.

The schematics_cli and angular_cli assume that they will be called from inside a project directory that contains the installed schematics. 

I have no issue with this, however, if I wanted to build an alternative CLI (or Electron application (which is what I intend to do)) that won't be executed from the directory that contains the schematics but instead references an alternative directory, then I need to rebuilt this entire class (or at least subclass and override the _resolveCollectionPath method).  This has highlighted that this class is tightly coupled to process.cwd and that this should instead be passed as an argument.

**More details**
 
Class NodeModulesEngineHost. Whilst methods _resolvePackageJson, _resolvePath accept a path to be provided, _resolveCollectionPath uses process.cwd() when calling them. This means that this class will always use the processes current working directory to identify schematics.

Instead, in my opinion, the class that creates the NodeModulesEngineHost should provide the baseDir. i.e. add (private path: string) to the constructor and then update the cli implementations to pass the path.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "NodeModuleEngineHost tightly coupled to process working directory" (#14935)

Issues.Title: bug(build-angular): lack of `Symbol.iterator` support in es5-polyfills
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: v7.x Until v7.x, build-angular uses core-js v2. This regression is caused by a breaking change of core-js v3. ### Description A clear and concise description of the problem... **Since v8.0, ES5 polyfills generated by Angular CLI doesn't have `Symbol.iterator` support.** Angular depends on `Symbol.iterator` in such as `HttpHeader` of `@angular/common/http`. https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/common/http/src/headers.ts#L255-L256 ``` Array.from(this.normalizedNames.keys()) ``` `Array.from(iterable)` is ES2015 feature which works with `Array.from` and `Symbol.iterator`. And legacy browsers like IE11 don't have it. So, its polyfill is necessary. CLI v7 used core-js v2 and its `core-js/es6/symbol` contains `Symbol.iterator` support. https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/7.3.x/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/angular-cli-files/models/es2015-polyfills.js Since core-js v3, `Symbol.iterator` has been seperated from `Symbol` itself. - https://github.com/zloirock/core-js/blob/v3.1.4/packages/core-js/modules/es.symbol.js - https://github.com/zloirock/core-js/blob/v3.1.4/packages/core-js/modules/es.symbol.iterator.js Because of that, to support IE11 Angular CLI should include `es.symbol.iterator.js` in `es5-polyfills`. But now CLI lacks it. https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/angular-cli-files/models/es5-polyfills.js#L10 ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ## üî• Exception or Error
No errors but `HttpClient.get(..., { headers })` doesn't send headers to server. ## üåç Your Environment
**Anything else relevant?**

Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 7.2.15 ### Description When you create minimal application, set the base href (e.g. "/test/") and access http://localhost:4200 instead of http://localhost:4200/test/. In Angular 7, setting the base href will redirect you to http://localhost:4200/test/ when you access http://localhost:4200. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction You can reproduce the problem by creating a minimal Angular application with the CLI. 
ng new angular-basehref-test --interactive=false
cd angular-basehref-test
ng serve --baseHref=/test/

Issues.Title: Invalidating lazy loaded modules
Issues.Body:
Hi!

Hopefully this is the correct repo to ask as I'm not sure if its more related to CLI or angular itself, just as I'm not sure if its intentional or possible bug/feature request, but here we go - I have following setup:

- Differential loading
- Lazy modules
- Angular source files hosted on CDN
- Angular app available on multiple domains

The problem I'm struggling with is that Angular requests all child modules with:

```javascript
https://cdn.net/app/30-es2015.js
https://cdn.net/app/31-es2015.js
```

When deploying new version I need to change the version query string (as can be seen above) as otherwise when angular requests:

```
https://cdn.net/app/30-es2015.js
```
it loads cached version because the `max-age` is set to a year and its cached in the CDN anyways so it wouldn't get latest version.

This would be ok if I could control the query string of lazy loaded modules. Is that possible?

Thank you for any suggestions or help :-)

```
Angular CLI: 8.0.4
Node: 10.13.0
OS: win32 x64
Angular: 8.1.0-next.3
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... platform-server, router

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------

@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.800.4
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.800.4
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.800.4

# üêû Bug report

### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are effected by this bug? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [x] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Is this a regression?

<!-- Did this behavior use to work in the previous version? -->

Not sure. Possibly a regression caused by the new builders API.


### Description

TSLint provides control on the rules' severity. The severity could be `warn`/`error`. Currently the CLI always exits with code 1 if there are linting errors found in the project.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
<!--
Simple steps to reproduce this bug.

Please include: commands run (including args), packages added, related code changes.

If reproduction steps are not enough for reproduction of your issue, please create a minimal GitHub repository with the reproduction of the issue. 
A good way to make a minimal reproduction is to create a new app via `ng new repro-app` and add the minimum possible code to show the problem. 
Share the link to the repo below along with step-by-step instructions to reproduce the problem, as well as expected and actual behavior.

Issues that don't have enough info and can't be reproduced will be closed.

You can read more about issue submission guidelines here: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#-submitting-an-issue
-->

1. In a project introduce a linting error.
1. Run `ng lint`
1. `echo $?`
1. Update the rule severity to `error`
1. Run `ng lint` again
1. `echo $?`

In both cases the output will be 1.

## üåç Your Environment

^8.0.0

Issues.Title: Hide panel of autocomplete on focus
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

What I would like to see is an option to disable the panel on focus.

#### Use Case

When a user focus on an autocomplete input I want the panel to be not opened.
After input it will open the panel.

#### What I tried

I have an FormArray within that FormArray I have multiple autocompletes.
For the phone the autocompletes are wrapped in an expansion panel.
When either the page open with default expansion panel or when a epansion panel get clicked it will selected the first input, in this case an autocomplete.
The autocomplete open with the panel open.
I can close it with `this.autoCompletes['_results'][0].closePanel();` which is a queryList of MatAutocompleteTrigger.
This will close the panel when I open the page.
But it doesn't if I open an expansion panel.
So I tried to add this on the focus event.
It seems that the panel will open after the focus event.
So the panel get closed before the panel get opened.

Also tried a timeout but this will first visible show the panel and then close it.

#### Solution

Either make the panel open earlier.
Make an input to disable the panel on focus.

#### Stackblitz
https://angular-sng8gx.stackblitz.io
Query list is not working for some reason..
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Hide panel of autocomplete on focus" (#16401)

Issues.Title: fix(ng-update): do not rely on node-glob for finding rule directories
Issues.Body:
We currently use `glob` in order to find rule directories automatically. This
has implications because it means that we depend on `glob` that is usually
brought in transitively by other project dependencies. This means that the
glob version is not guaranteed to be working due to previous `glob`
issues on windows.

Related to #16208
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(ng-update): do not rely on node-glob for finding rule directories" (#16381)

Issues.Title: Chip autocomplete doesn't support showing error colour and message
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-n6tpca?file=app/chips-autocomplete-example.ts

Steps to reproduce:
1. select a fruit, and then remove it. The boolean display TRUE (invalid) all the time because we set the input formControl to null. The input is invalid, but the invalid class is not projected to the mat-form-field.

Issues.Title: Performance degradation when using an animated progress bar with multiple monitors
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/fork/components-issue

Steps to reproduce:
1. Setup two monitors: 144hz, 60hz.
2. Open the progress bar example with the buffer mode: https://components-issue-4bf67t.stackblitz.io
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?

Using animations should not significantly affect system performance.


#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?

There is a performance impact on the main monitor with massive stutters. It forces the main display at 60hz.

It was not reproduced by me because I don't have multiple monitors but was reported by users multiple times with the same monitor configurations.

The problem was fixed by switching the animation mode from 'buffer' to 'determinate'. It was confirmed by users.

I'm creating this issue to find more affected people.

Feedbacks from affected users:
```
there's an issue with 144hz/60hz dual monitors setups with the website. The fact that there's that pretty animation scrolling on the bottom forces the display to update at 60hz, which, through the power of the magnificent DWM that can't handle this in 2019, forces the main display at 60hz and with massive stutters. Switching to a different tab in the browser fixes this.
```
```
this is gonna sound weird, but when i had the tab with the site open just now on my secondary monitor and waiting for a trade to pop, it really killed the performance of my game client. like it was forcing a vsync ingame or something, very noticeably choppy. it could be just a one off thing i dont know, just bringing it up in case anyone else gets that and can confirm/deny. my primary monitor is 144hz, secondary is 60hz.
i could just need a pc restart. my pc acts weird sometimes when i wake it from sleep and just go about doing my normal stuff
```

#### Environment

- Angular: 8.0.0
- CDK/Material: 8.0.0
- Browser(s): Google Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Performance degradation when using an animated progress bar with multiple monitors" (#16389)

Issues.Title: MatSelect- "Open Down Always"
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

The logic in the select to figure out whether to open up or down is great, but if we don't want this behavior there's no easy way to get around it.  If we just want the autocomplete to open downward all the time, even if it goes off the screen, or upwards, there should be a way to indicate this.

`@Input positioning: FLEXIBLE | UP | DOWN`

Same concept as `matAutocompletePosition` for Autocomplete

#### Use Case

Client does not want flexible positioning, UI requires the overlay to open "like a drawer" downward at all times
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MatSelect- "Open Down Always"" (#16383)

Issues.Title: feat(drag-drop): add support for automatic scrolling
Issues.Body:
* Adds support for automatically scrolling either the list or the viewport when the user's cursor gets within a certain threshold of the edges (currently within 5% inside and outside).
* Handles changes to the scroll position of both the list and the viewport while the user is dragging. Previously our positioning would break down and we'd emit incorrect data.
* No longer blocks the mouse wheel scrolling while the user is dragging.
* Allows the consumer to opt out of the automatic scrolling.

Fixes #13588.
![list-demo](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4450522/60122076-bafb0100-9784-11e9-9f30-3d0d5b44038b.gif)
![viewport-demo](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4450522/60122077-bafb0100-9784-11e9-8b23-bf79c4cebb73.gif)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(drag-drop): add support for automatic scrolling" (#16382)

Issues.Body:

## Bug, enhancement request, or proposal:

<!-- Please note that we are not accepting major feature requests, i.e. requests for new components, at this time. -->

# CodePen and steps to reproduce the issue:
#### [CodePen Demo](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-tooltip-material-syx76p?file=src%2Fapp%2Ftooltip%2Fbasictooltip.html) which demonstrates the issue: 


#### Detailed Reproduction Steps: 
1. after page load go to page inspect try to find "dynamic tooltip message" button tooltip. Unable to find
2. after page load go to page inspect try to find "staic tooltip message" button tooltip. Working fine
3. Unable to do automation due to this issue.
### What is the expected behavior?
even in data binding  page inspect should able to find tooltip message

### What is the current behavior?
page inspect unable to find tooltip message

### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
in Devoops world Automation is very important. it will break to find tooltip messages when it is loading from ts file.

### Which versions of AngularJS, Material, OS, and browsers are affected?
<!-- Please note that only issues related to AngularJS 1.x and AngularJS Material 1.x should be submitted here.
Please submit Angular Material and CDK questions [here](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/angular-material2) and issues [here](https://github.com/angular/components/issues).
-->
- Angular: 7.2.9.
- Angular Material: 7.3.0.
- OS: windows
- Browsers: chrome 75.0.3770.100
 
### Is there anything else we should know? Stack Traces, Screenshots, etc.
If we use direct tooltip message in html page working fine
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37655646/60101010-913bdd00-9778-11e9-9b37-a6a4e97094b2.png)

If we use Ts file message and do binding at thtml it is failing to find tooltip message
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37655646/60101088-be888b00-9778-11e9-9f2a-36f747369eaf.png)
